column1: full inswinger curling into the stumps and Vijay comes onto the front foot to nudge towards midwicket. Looked like inside edge onto pad
length ball, swerving into off stump, clipped to mid-on
this one leaves Vohra in the corridor and he takes a big stride forward and leaves it alone
shortish outside off, another outswinger, Vohra dabs it away to third man
back of a length outside off, swings away from Vijay who shoulders arms

Vijay shuffles across, looking for a ball he can work into the less-populated leg side, and Praveen bowls his outswinger a little wider, on a good length, and produces a leading edge that trickles down to third man
length ball on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
fuller, much wider, Vijay reaches out for a square drive and can't put bat to ball
back of a length angling across, Vijay clears his front leg to hit over mid-on, and the ball swerves in just a touch to beat his inside edge and hit high on the back thigh
length ball outside off, pushed to cover point
down the track comes Vijay, and Sangwan looks to shorten his length a little. Doesn't matter to Vijay, who steps away to make a bit of hitting room and simply swats it over the long-on boundary
wide half-volley, and any batsman at this level will put that away to the cover boundary. Vijay just does it a little more elegantly than most, hitting it sweetly between extra cover and mid-off
length ball swinging into off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on
fullish outside off, Vijay gets his head over the ball for a gentle push towards mid-off
back of a length, swings in towards off stump to cramp Vohra for room. He lets it come to him and uses his wrists to play it to mid-on
back of a length on off stump, tucked away to the right of mid-on
length ball outside off, gives Vijay just enough width to caress it to the cover point boundary, on the up
nice length in the corridor, and Vijay looks to dab it to third man with half a bat. The ball swings away late and beats his outside edge
back of a length, swinging down leg, tucked off the hip towards fine leg
length ball on middle stump, pushed to short extra cover. Vohra is eager for a single and Vijay - rightly - sends him back, seeing Finch close in quickly
length ball swinging into middle stump, and Vijay twirls his wrists to place that beautifully, to the left of short fine leg and to the right of deep square leg

length ball on off stump, and what a shot that is, just shows the full face and it races past the stumps at the other end and leaves mid-off sprawled uselessly to his right. Long-on runs around to stop it
slower ball on off stump, on a length, and Vijay gets forward, waits the fraction longer that the ball demands, and opens his bat face slightly to place that drive between cover point and extra cover
length ball close to off stump, driven straight to cover point this time
overpitched on middle and off, and Vohra drives it firmly down the ground, thumps it between non-striker and mid-off

dropped! Bravo runs in from deep midwicket as Vohra pulls in the air, the ball wasn't as short as he thought and hurried onto him. He gets both hands to it, on the dive, but the ball pops out as he lands. Vohra goes for the second, the throw goes to the keeper's end, and he has to dive to complete the run. They go upstairs to check, and he's okay.
back of a length, angling away from off stump. Vohra pokes with leaden feet and misses
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
this one's on leg stump, a little shorter, and Vohra flicks it away easily, up and over the square leg fielder
length ball slanting away from off stump and giving Vohra swinging room, and he uses it to flat-bat it in the air, to the left of mid-off
skidder slanting down leg, and Vijay looks to flick and misses. The ball hits him on the pad and prompts an excited but futile appeal from the bowler
on the pads again, a bit shorter, worked to deep midwicket
tossed up wide of off stump and Vohra drags a sweep out to deep midwicket
slowly flighted on leg stump, and that's asking for trouble with mid-on in the ring. Vijay simply gets his front leg out of the way and lofts that over the fielder

oh, excellent. If you're going to bowl that slow, that's the length you should bowl. Vijay comes forward to defend, is deceived in the flight, and it turns away to beat his edge and DK has the bails off quickly. They've gone upstairs for this... Vijay did drag his foot out, but he's pulled it back into the crease just in time.
back of a length, flatter, on middle stump. Vijay goes back and works it away through midwicket
full, angling down leg. Vijay can't connect with the flick and it rolls off the pad into the short fine leg region
flat length ball angling down leg. This time Vohra misses the flick and is hit on the pad
again, this time a bit shorter. Vohra is playing for turn, looking to flick, and the ball slides on with the angle and hits the outside part of his pad
and again, a quickish length ball angling down leg. It's going in that direction because he's getting no turn, and it runs off Vohra's pad towards short fine leg
full on leg stump, clipped through square leg
flighted ball outside off, chipped in the air to the right of sweeper cover
wrong 'un, and Vijay plays down the wrong line, looking to flick on the front foot. Big lbw appeal but that was sliding down leg
tossed up outside off, slog-swept along the ground to the right of deep midwicket
and again, another firm sweep, but it's closer to deep midwicket and they can only take one run before Jadeja's throw rockets in
down the track now and he picks the right ball. It's tossed up high, and he meets it on the full and launches it high over the bowler's head for a 105m six
another really slow ball, and this one lands short, giving Vohra ample time to rock back and pull into the gap between deep midwicket and long-on
quicker length ball, sliding on towards off stump. Vohra lets it come on and dabs towards short third man
once again, Jadeja fires one down the leg side, and this time Vohra's pad isn't in the way
a little bit slower through the air, on middle and leg, and Vohra is quickly down on his back knee to slog-sweep it over deep midwicket

first an aborted appeal, then a bigger one, and the finger goes up. This one skids on from back of a length, and Vohra, looking to work that through the leg side, gets an inside edge into his pad. Jadeja was appealing for lbw at first, but he realised the batsman had hit that, and then he appealed for caught behind as DK ran to his right and grabbed the ball that had popped up gently off Vohra's pad
full on middle stump, jabbed back to the bowler
sees Miller coming down the track and bowls it quicker and shorter, and Miller plays an ungainly whip across the line, but he manages to hit it wide of short fine leg
once again, on the pads, clipped straight to short fine leg this time
fuller, on the stumps, clipped to midwicket
slower ball, full outside off. Vijay gets on the front foot and opens his bat face to steer it to third man
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
bouncer rising over middle and off. It goes through pretty quick and Vijay simply sways away from the line
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked away gently into the vacant midwicket area, and they run two and challenge Jadeja's rocket arm as he sprints in from the boundary

slower ball outside off. Vijay looks to make room to drive through cover, and the ball grips a little, comes in just a touch, and that combined with the shot being played too early means he hits it straight back to the bowler
steps away from leg stump to make room and Bravo follows him with a full slower ball. Vijay whips it out to deep square leg
length ball sliding into leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
down the track and Jadeja fires it at his pads. Clipped to deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, whipped to deep square leg
bowled him! Saw Vijay step away to make room for the inside-out chip over the covers, and he dragged his length back a bit and got it to turn just enough to go past the edge and hit middle stump
quiet, for now. Length ball on off stump, pushed gently to the left of short extra cover

down the track and this time Miller gets his front pad away from the line as Jadeja looks to fire it in and cramp him for hitting room. With the pad out of the way, he gets a clean, free swing of the bat in to launch that high over wide long-on
short ball on middle stump, swivels to pull it to deep square leg
looks for the yorker, gets his line slightly wrong and slips it down the leg side
slower length ball close to off stump, pushed down the ground with a straight bat. Long-on runs across in an enthusiastic diagonal to cut it off before it can reach long-off
bouncer, skids through at head height at 131kph and Maxwell sways his head away from the line
yorker, pinpoint, and it crashes into the base of middle and leg as Maxwell, looking to make himself room, misses the ball, looking to stab it through point
digs it in short outside off, and Saha jumps across to dab it to third man

now he's top of the pile all by himself. It's the slower yorker, that's a bewitching, dipping delivery that Miller plays across and all around. Stunning way to get to 300 T20 wickets, absolutely top delivery

Is that another wicket? Back of a length ball, sliding onto off stump, and it's dabbed towards point. The non-striker wants the single, and Saha sends him back. The throw is at the bowler's end, it's a direct hit, and Stoinis has to dive to get home. His bat is over the line. He will not be out for a zero-ball duck.
tossed up on off stump and he shuffles across to clip into the vacant midwicket area, looking for two. Jadeja sprints across in his follow-through to keep it down to one
flat, fullish, on the pads, clipped to the left of short fine leg
down the track to the flighted ball wide of off stump, squeezes the push past the diving extra cover fielder
flatter now, back of a length, and Stoinis whips it from outside off, into the midwicket region
tossed up outside off, pushed down the ground to long-off
back of a length slower ball on off stump, flicked away towards deep midwicket
shortish, angling into middle and leg, clipped away towards deep backward square leg
slower ball outside off, gets a good stride forward for a push to sweeper cover
slower ball, in the blockhole outside off, jabbed to short extra cover
short ball, and this one's a long hop sliding down leg. Stoinis steps across, allowing him to help the pull wide of short fine leg and pick up four
dipping slower ball outside off. Stoinis meets it on the full to drive, but it hits low on the bat and he hits it straight to the bowler
length ball angling away from off stump, poked away to the right of backward point
looks for the slower ball and gets his line horribly wrong, way down the leg side
shortish on middle and leg and Stoinis jumps to tuck it away towards long leg. Excellent, aggressive running to pick up two, putting pressure on the man coming in off the boundary
short and wide, and Stoinis slaps it away, hitting it on the top of the bounce and beating the backward point fielder diving to his right

length ball on middle stump, looks for the push towards mid-off and Faulkner sprints around to intercept. Stoinis was out of his crease, looking for the single, and Faulkner throws at his end, and hits the diving batsman's bat
slogs across the line of a slower ball, toe-ends it to long-on
another slower ball slips down the leg side
on the pads, clipped towards deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, poked away into the covers
yorker on middle stump, squeezed out into the mid-on region
back of a length, skids on towards middle and leg and cramps Saha for room, and he can only block into the off side
excellent slower ball, shortish and wide of off. Saha goes for the pull and the ball dips under his bat and rolls to the keeper
another middle-stump yorker, flicked away towards deep square leg
another slower bouncer, turns into Stoinis, who pulls it away to the right of deep square leg
wide, full slower ball, and Saha misses the flat-bat drive
slower ball outside off and Saha shuffles across to work it to the right of deep square leg. More inside edge than intention there.
shorter now, this slower ball, and it doesn't miss the top of off stump by much after it sneaks under Stoinis' attempted pull
fuller, angling into off stump, slugged away to deep midwicket
back of a length slower ball outside off, gets across and pushes to the right of extra cover. They take two by the time Raina sprints across and stops the ball with a sprawling dive
back of a length slower ball angling into middle stump. Stoinis shuffles across to work it to the right of deep square leg
down the track and PK yorks him. Stabbed down the ground towards long-off

looks to make room and he follows him with another blockhole ball. Saha times the straight punch brilliantly, but only manages to hit the stumps at the other end. They steal a single while it ricochets into the off side
in the blockhole again, jabbed down to long-off
looks for the yorker to follow Saha as he moves away from leg stump. It ends up as a low full-toss, and Saha chips it in the air, but on the bounce to long-off
another yorker, stabbed firmly into the ground and it bounces over the bowler. They take two this time while Bravo runs around from long-off
shot! PK's yorkers were getting a little predictable, and Stoinis steps across, exposing his stumps, and laps it away, over the keeper, to the fine leg boundary
wide, full slower ball, and Saha slices it high in the air. Kishan comes in from the cover boundary, dives, and drops it.
another slower ball, and Saha slogs and misses
very full, wide of off, stabbed away to the right of sweeper cover
looks to step across for a scoop over short fine leg, but it's the slower one again, and he's through his shot too early. He misses the ball and it hits him on the pad
full outside off, swiped to long-on
slower ball wide of off, and this time Stoinis was expecting it. He stands still, sets himself up on a stable base, and drills the flat-bat drive hard, to the right of sweeper cover

Looks to make room to hit over the covers, and Bravo bowls a slower length ball, which he hits high - but not very far - over the on side. It drops into no-man's land as long-on runs in to try and catch it
yorker on middle and leg, and Stoinis - stepping away to make room - can only stab it to extra cover
another slower ball, back of a length, and Saha can't get any power on his shot as he clears his front leg and clubs over the top. Hits it straight to deep midwicket
slower length ball on off stump and now it's Stoinis' turn to hole out. Looks to make swinging room and launch it down the ground, and can only hit it down the throat of Finch running in from long-on
full, gives him a bit of width, and he drills his drive between extra cover and mid-off. Finch runs back from mid-off to stop it before it reaches the boundary

Axar steps out and Bravo slants the slower ball away from him. He slogs at it, and slices it high in the air off the outside half of the bat. Ladda comes in from short third man to catch it, but misjudges the catch, ends up having to reach out for the ball, and it slips through his fingers. The drop denies Bravo a five-for, but he's bowled outstandingly nonetheless
back of a length, swinging into off stump, blocked back to the bowler
fuller now, and Finch is rooted to the crease as he looks to whip across the line. Swings in, beats the bat and hits the pad. Big appeal, not given. May have slid down the leg side
back of a length outside off. Makes room and has to reach out to hit the ball, can only flap it towards extra cover
fullish outside off, slogged in the air, on the bounce to long-on. Interesting field placement there. Deep backward square leg and long-on were the two fielders back for Finch.
length inswinger on off stump, defended into the on side

stumped, off a fast bowler! That was excellent stuff. We all knew McCullum would jump out of his crease at some point, and Sandeep pulls his length back just a bit and gets the ball to shape away. McCullum pokes at the ball, which swerves past his outside edge, and he's stranded a long way down when Saha whips off the bails
length ball slanting away from off stump, left alone

slower ball close to off stump and Finch doesn't middle the attempted hit over mid-off. Ends up skewing it high off the outside half of the bat - the offcutter gripped and left Finch a little - and it just manages to clear extra cover chasing back
fuller, a bit wider. This one's a slower ball too, and the width allows Finch to get under the ball and slice it up and over cover point
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended into the covers
bangs it in short, angles it into the batsman, and Finch swivels quickly on his back foot - and his bat speed is even quicker - to pull to the backward square leg boundary
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg
back of a length close to off stump, and Finch punches crisply off the back foot, but Axar dives full-length to his left from extra cover to stop it

back of a length outside off, stops on him a touch and he drags the ball to mid-off - while aiming into the covers. They look to sneak a quick single, and Miller swoops and underarms towards the bowlers end, and they end up getting two thanks to the overthrow
back of a length on middle and leg, cramping Raina for room. Blocked back to the bowler
length ball on off stump, and Raina punishes it. Gets under it and scoops it high over mid-off with a straight bat
back of a length, leg-stumpish, tucked off the hips towards long leg
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to deep square leg
length ball outside off stump and Finch just stands there and swipes it away to the right of mid-on
back of a length on off stump, and Finch is sitting back, waiting for this sort of ball, and swivels to club it between midwicket and mid-on
back of a length on middle and off, pushed towards mid-on and they sneak the quick single
back of a length close to off stump, and Raina opens his bat face and plays that familiar dab to point
fullish outside off, Raina defends towards mid-on, his bat coming down at an angle
slower ball, but it's short, sitting up at hip height, and Raina shuffles across to pull, doesn't really get hold of it, but gets enough on it to help it between keeper and short fine leg
length ball slanting away from off stump. Finch slices his drive to backward point

shortish, and it's rising over middle stump, cramping Finch for room, but he plays it so well, jumping to get on top of the bounce, letting it come on, and opening his bat face to guide it wide of short third man
length ball speared in towards off stump. Finch uses the angle to nudge it through backward square leg
length ball, looks to angle it into the left-hander, and overdoes the angle, slides down the leg side
fuller, but once again he slips it down the leg side
back of a length, a bit of movement in towards off stump. Raina lets it come on and dabs it softly into the off side for an easy single
length ball angling into off stump, dabbed towards backward point
length ball wide of off, steered down to third man
slower ball in the blockhole on middle stump, clipped gently into the midwicket region
shortish on off stump, sits up, and Raina clears his front leg and slogs it away powerfully, just clears the midwicket boundary

slower ball and Raina holes out! He had stepped away from leg stump, looking to make room to hit over mid-off or extra cover. He had to reach for the ball, and played too early, and ended up scooping it to Johnson running back from mid-on to complete a very well-judged catch
slower ball close to off stump, punched back towards the bowler
slower ball again, but it's shorter, and there's some width too, and Finch stands still, waits, and cuts it away to the right of backward point
fuller, loopy slower ball outside off, driven to extra cover, where Miller misfields - probably bad bounce as he bent down to field it - and gives away a single
flat length ball close to off stump, stabbed into the covers
back of a length on middle stump, tucked away to deep square leg
super shot from DK. It's just a touch short, not too wide, but he's quickly deep in his crease to cut it away to the left of the sprawling point fielder
tossed up a little more, on middle stump, gets on the front foot to clip towards long-on
on the pads, quickish, a bad ball given the field he has, and Finch clips it away to the left of short fine leg and deep square leg has no chance to run around and stop it
tossed up on off stump, driven to sweeper cover

shortish slower ball wide of off stump, and however slow it is, it's still short and wide, and he bowls it with backward point and third man in the circle. Finch waits, gets on top of the bounce, and pierces the gap with a surgically executed cut
another slower ball, this one's a loopy full-toss on off stump, and he clips it down to long-on
full outside off, driven to sweeper cover

back of a length slower offcutter, and Finch plays it so cleverly. It cuts into him, towards off stump, giving him just enough hitting room to play a tennis-style swat down the ground, didn't hit it too hard, just timed it, and easily beat long-on running to his left
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on
loopy full-toss on off stump, and DK just shows it the full face and punches firmly down the ground, giving long-on and long-off no chance
full on off stump, driven to long-off
back of a length on middle, punched towards short extra cover
quickish length ball wide of off, pushed to sweeper cover
length ball on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
full on off stump, whipped to long-on
speared in flat, and he ends up sliding it down the leg side
length ball on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
starts with a short ball outside off, punched to sweeper cover
short, a little more width, slapped to sweeper cover
short again, and this time it sits up so slow that Finch can go deep in his crease and pull it ferociously to the left of deep midwicket
shortish outside off, whipped down the ground to long-on
back of a length on middle and off, and Karthik sits deep in his crease to steer it to deep point
short again, outside off, chopped away to that busy sweeper fielder
full on off stump and it's driven back firmly down the ground. Long-on runs to his left and stops it with a sprawling dive
low full-toss on off stump, punched down to long-on
length ball on off stump, pushed to extra cover, who's right on the edge of the 30-yard circle, so they can push for the single
bouncer outside off, and it rises high but rises slow, and Finch waits, waits some more, and then reaches out to ramp it to the third man boundary
slower ball outside off, on a length, looks for the cover drive but ends up dragging it down to long-off
length ball on off stump, Karthik closes his bat face too early, looking to play it through midwicket with the angle, and plays it back to the bowler off the leading edge
back of a length close to off stump, googly, punched down the ground to long-on
tossed up on off stump, and Karthik loves to sweep, he places this perfectly, hitting it firmly to the square leg boundary
much slower, and gets some sharp turn away from off stump. DK looks for the cute lap sweep and top-edges it towards short third man
slashed away. It's short and wide again, and Finch slaps it fiercely and just eludes the fingertips of the leaping backward point fielder

he's walking. That was an excellent bit of bowling. He's achieved turn by bowling it slower, and he's done it again. It drops on a good length outside off, shorter than Finch expects as he stretches out to it, and all that stretching leaves him far out of the crease when it turns past his defensive bat, and Saha completes the stumping quickly and efficiently. Finch is livid with himself, throwing his gloves down as he crosses the rope on his walk back
not short or wide enough to cut, and Jadeja ends up chopping it into the leg side off the inside edge
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs to third man
full, slanting away from the left-hander and pitching wide of off stump. Jadeja leaves it alone
back of a length this time, once again wide of off stump, and it beats Jadeja as he reaches out to slash
back of a length outside off, steered to the left of third man
slower ball, fairly full on middle stump. Jadeja presses forward and defends into the off side
back of a length, another slower ball. Straighter this time, and Jadeja tucks it off his legs to fine leg
tossed up on middle and off, whipped away with the turn to deep midwicket
tossed up wide of off stump, flat-batted to the left of long-off
length ball on off stump, blocked studiously into the covers

tossed up on middle stump, and Jadeja gets into an unstable position, getting his front leg out of the way but not quickly enough to stabilise before going through with the big hit. Lifts it over the bowler and it bounces well short of the rope
back of a length close to off stump, makes a bit of room and stabs it towards point

reverse-sweep, and that is smart thinking. He had a slip and a backward point and no one in the vast expanse between those two. Karthik saw a bit of flight and a bit of room outside off stump, and was able to execute the shot easily as a result
fired in full at the pads, and it hits the pads and dribbles down towards fine leg after Jadeja misses the flick
length ball on off stump. Jadeja is stuck to the crease, moving neither forward nor back, and simply shows the ball the full face to push towards mid-on

a run-out! Back of a length, angling into off stump, and DK tucks it into the leg side and takes off for the single. He barely gets any wood on the shot, and it's only dribbling by the side of the pitch, and Johnson sprints through in his follow-through and kicks the ball onto the stumps at the keeper's end, finding Jadeja well short of his crease
fullish, on middle stump, clipped to deep midwicket
bouncer angling in from wide of the crease, and Karthik sways his head away from the line and gets down low to evade the ball, keeping his eye on it all the way through
back of a length close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs towards backward point

ooh, nearly another run out. Kishan stretches out to this tossed-up ball on middle stump, and it dips and turns in as he looks to flick, rolls off his pad into the leg side. DK quickly calls Kishan through for the single, and Kishan has to dive at the non-striker's end. Direct hit would have made things interesting
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point
slow flight outside off, swept in the air, but bounces well short of the deep square leg fielder
sees him coming down the track and fires it quicker. Kishan looks for the big hit with the turn and inside-edges into his pads
down the track again, fired in flat outside leg stump, whipped in the air, on the bounce towards deep square leg

googly, but it starts outside leg stump, and Kishan plays this very well, a straight-bat paddle sweep - Sachin Tendulkar used to play this shot in this manner - into the gap to the left of short fine leg
down the track comes Karthik, and makes a bit of room to flat-bat the fullish ball powerfully in the air, wide of mid-off

shortish outside off, dabbed to the left of backward point. Takes off for the single, not realising that Axar throws left-handed. Axar's throw at the keeper's end misses, with Karthik stranded halfway down the pitch, and they complete the single with a sigh of relief
slower bouncer, and Kishan misses the pull
fullish on off stump, not full enough to deny him swinging room or elevation, and he simply swipes this away, cleanly over midwicket

down the track, stepping away from leg stump to make some room. Johnson fires it full and wide, making Kishan reach for the ball. He goes after it, slices it high in the air, and Mohit Sharma takes a simple catch at backward point, but only after juggling it a couple of times. That ended up stuck in the crook of his elbow.

back of a length on off stump, and what a shot that is from Karthik! Punches it firmly, full face showing, and his feet go off the ground at the point of impact. The ball races away between non-striker and mid-off
slower short ball outside off, and Bravo plays a half-pull, half-whip out to deep square leg
slower ball wide of off, and Karthik spots it early, clears his front leg, and flat-bats it hard to long-on
slower bouncer outside off, Bravo plays a controlled pull out to deep square leg

down the track and he spots the slower short ball quickly, gets into a lovely stable position, and pulls it witheringly to the left of deep square leg to seal a comfortable win, on debut, for Gujarat Lions
